title: Agentic Planning Methods (Table 2)
content:
Section 3.1.1 · Planning

Representative Planning Systems

Table 2: Agentic Planning Systems

MethodStructureFormatTool
Modality I: Language Agents (Search, Code)
ReWOODecomposedNatural LanguageNone
ReflexionSequentialNatural LanguageNone
LLM+PSequentialFormal LanguageNone
ToTTreeNatural LanguageNone
GoTGraphNatural LanguageNone
HTPHypertreeNatural LanguageRetrieval
GorillaSequentialProgramming LanguageRetrieval, API
CodeNavSequentialProgramming LanguageCode Index, Code Search
Modality II: Visual/Multimodal Agents (GUI, Embodied)
VisualPredictorTreeFormal LanguageNone
LLM-PlannerTreeFormal LanguageObject Detector, KNN
Agent-ESequentialFormal LanguageDOM Grounder, Screenshot
AESOPReactiveNatural LanguageAnomaly Detector
BehaviorGPTSequentialVisual FeaturesWorld Model

This search-over-hierarchy view maps cleanly onto domain systems. In the web setting, planner-executor architectures generate high-level subtask trees in natural language and bind leaves to DOM-grounded actions, often with memory to persist context.

Analysis & Explanation

Choosing a Planning Method

Selection Criteria
  • Sequential: Simple tasks, linear workflows
  • Tree/Graph: Exploration, backtracking needed
  • With Tools: Tasks requiring external data or actions
